content.description: Start low, matched under a small roof. Work your way out of it to the top.
content.location: See directions for Choss Ball. It’s the problem directly to the right of it.

content.description: Short and sweet. Start low and make left move to pocket and then up. Gets its name from the second picture, dislodged it when cleaning it off.
content.location: Better directions will be posted as some point. After reaching the first boulders, head left and this side of the boulder will be facing you

content.description: Tucked further away into the hills in regards to Bush Creek. Several standalone boulders with the potential for many problems. Use common sense back here though, check the rock before climbing. If the rock seems, feels, and/or sounds hollow; it is, and will come loose with the proper amount of force. Adams County limestone ain’t the best out there. Climb at your own risk, per usual.
